medical_history.chief_complaint: Headache, slowed speech and cognition, weakness on the left side, and a mass in the brain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until several months before admission when she began feeling vaguely ill. Approximately 10 days before admission, a severe throbbing headache developed that was different from her usual headaches. Inattentiveness and slowing of thinking and speech were noted by her family, along with mild weakness on the left side. She experienced a tendency to veer to the left while walking or driving and worsening depression. Evaluation revealed anemia two days before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, depression, dysmenorrhea, menometrorrhagia with uterine fibroids, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and previous ankle fracture after a fall.
medical_history.family_history: Father and aunt had lymphoma (aunt had CNS involvement), mother had hyperlipidemia, sister had thyroid cancer, and brother had hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lived with her husband and one adult child, smoked less than 1 pack of cigarettes per week until 1 week before admission, drank wine occasionally, and did not use illicit drugs.
